hypothesis_content.title: BTC Post-News Reversal After Extreme Sentiment Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When Bitcoin experiences a >5% intraday price move driven by a major news catalyst (e.g., treasury purchase, ETF flow announcement) and the 1-hour RSI exceeds 80 (or falls below 20), a mean reversion move of at least 2% in the opposite direction will occur within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven moves often overextend due to emotional/algorithmic reaction. Extreme RSI in short timeframe combined with volume spike suggests exhaustion. Current neutral regime (61.5%) with mixed news flow (BitMine buying vs. XRP sentiment analysis) creates conditions for whipsaw.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour RSI > 80 (or < 20) following a >5% intraday move
Move is accompanied by identifiable major news headline (catalyst check)
Volume on the move is >150% of 20-period average
Enter on the first 30-minute candle close after RSI condition is met

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2% price move in opposite direction from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >70% of such setups result in continuation rather than reversal over 100+ samples across 2025 data.
